author: Staff Reporter
text:
Puthiya Thamizhagam leader K. Krishnasamy on Monday moved the Madras High Court challenging the recent appointment of 11 members to the Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC). The appointments have already been challenged by the PMK and DMK.

According to Dr. Krishnasamy, the State government has made the appointments “all of a sudden in a hurried manner without verifying the antecedents and the qualifications of the members.”

He also alleged that seven of the newly-appointed members are politically affiliated to the ruling AIADMK.

‘Quash appointments’

The petitioner wanted the court to quash the appointments on the ground that they are illegal and unconstitutional.

When the petition came up for hearing before the First Bench comprising Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M.M. Sundresh, the Bench directed the court registry to tag the petition along with two other similar pleas moved by the PMK and DMK.
title: PT challenges appointment of TNPSC members
